1.verse: Christ Comes to the World - In the beginning there was the Word. The Word was with God, and the Word was God.

2.verse: He was with God in the beginning.

3.verse: All things were made by him, and nothing was made without him.

4.verse: In him there was life, and that life was the light of all people.

5.verse: The Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overpowered it.

6.verse: There was a man named John who was sent by God.

7.verse: He came to tell people the truth about the Light so that through him all people could hear about the Light and believe.

8.verse: John was not the Light, but he came to tell people the truth about the Light.

9.verse: The true Light that gives light to all was coming into the world!

10.verse: The Word was in the world, and the world was made by him, but the world did not know him.

11.verse: He came to the world that was his own, but his own people did not accept him.

12.verse: But to all who did accept him and believe in him he gave the right to become children of God.

13.verse: They did not become his children in any human way—by any human parents or human desire. They were born of God.

14.verse: The Word became a human and lived among us. We saw his glory—the glory that belongs to the only Son of the Father—and he was full of grace and truth.

15.verse: John tells the truth about him and cries out, saying, “This is the One I told you about: ‘The One who comes after me is greater than I am, because he was living before me.’”

16.verse: Because he was full of grace and truth, from him we all received one gift after another.

17.verse: The law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.

18.verse: No one has ever seen God. But God the only Son is very close to the Father, and he has shown us what God is like.

19.verse: John Tells People About Jesus - Here is the truth John told when the leaders in Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him, “Who are you?”

20.verse: John spoke freely and did not refuse to answer. He said, “I am not the Christ.”

21.verse: So they asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” He answered, “No, I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” they asked. He answered, “No.”

22.verse: Then they said, “Who are you? Give us an answer to tell those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”

23.verse: John told them in the words of the prophet Isaiah: “I am the voice of one calling out in the desert: ‘Make the road straight for the Lord.’” Isaiah 40:3

24.verse: Some Pharisees who had been sent asked John:

25.verse: “If you are not the Christ or Elijah or the Prophet, why do you baptize people?”

26.verse: John answered, “I baptize with water, but there is one here with you that you don’t know about.

27.verse: He is the One who comes after me. I am not good enough to untie the strings of his sandals.”

28.verse: This all happened at Bethany on the other side of the Jordan River, where John was baptizing people.

29.verse: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him. John said, “Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

30.verse: This is the One I was talking about when I said, ‘A man will come after me, but he is greater than I am, because he was living before me.’

31.verse: Even I did not know who he was, although I came baptizing with water so that the people of Israel would know who he is.”

32.verse: Then John said, “I saw the Spirit come down from heaven in the form of a dove and rest on him. Until then I did not know who the Christ was. But the God who sent me to baptize with water told me, ‘You will see the Spirit come down and rest on a man; he is the One who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.’

33.verse: Then John said, “I saw the Spirit come down from heaven in the form of a dove and rest on him. Until then I did not know who the Christ was. But the God who sent me to baptize with water told me, ‘You will see the Spirit come down and rest on a man; he is the One who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.’

34.verse: I have seen this happen, and I tell you the truth: This man is the Son of God.”

35.verse: The First Followers of Jesus - The next day John was there again with two of his followers.

36.verse: When he saw Jesus walking by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”

37.verse: The two followers heard John say this, so they followed Jesus.

38.verse: When Jesus turned and saw them following him, he asked, “What are you looking for?” They said, “Rabbi, where are you staying?” (“Rabbi” means “Teacher.”)

39.verse: He answered, “Come and see.” So the two men went with Jesus and saw where he was staying and stayed there with him that day. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.

40.verse: One of the two men who followed Jesus after they heard John speak about him was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.

41.verse: The first thing Andrew did was to find his brother Simon and say to him, “We have found the Messiah.” (“Messiah” means “Christ.”)

42.verse: Then Andrew took Simon to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas.” (“Cephas” means “Peter.”)

43.verse: The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”

44.verse: Philip was from the town of Bethsaida, where Andrew and Peter lived.

45.verse: Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the man that Moses wrote about in the law, and the prophets also wrote about him. He is Jesus, the son of Joseph, from Nazareth.”

46.verse: But Nathanael said to Philip, “Can anything good come from Nazareth?” Philip answered, “Come and see.”

47.verse: As Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him, he said, “Here is truly an Israelite. There is nothing false in him.”

48.verse: Nathanael asked, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered, “I saw you when you were under the fig tree, before Philip told you about me.”

49.verse: Then Nathanael said to Jesus, “Teacher, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel.”

50.verse: Jesus said to Nathanael, “Do you believe simply because I told you I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than that.”

51.verse: And Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, you will all see heaven open and ‘angels of God going up and coming down’ on the Son of Man.”

1.verse: The Wedding at Cana - Two days later there was a wedding in the town of Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,

2.verse: and Jesus and his followers were also invited to the wedding.

3.verse: When all the wine was gone, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no more wine.”

4.verse: Jesus answered, “Dear woman, why come to me? My time has not yet come.”

5.verse: His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you to do.”

6.verse: In that place there were six stone water jars that the Jews used in their washing ceremony. Each jar held about twenty or thirty gallons.

7.verse: Jesus said to the servants, “Fill the jars with water.” So they filled the jars to the top.

8.verse: Then he said to them, “Now take some out and give it to the master of the feast.” So they took the water to the master.

9.verse: When he tasted it, the water had become wine. He did not know where the wine came from, but the servants who had brought the water knew. The master of the wedding called the bridegroom

10.verse: and said to him, “People always serve the best wine first. Later, after the guests have been drinking awhile, they serve the cheaper wine. But you have saved the best wine till now.”

11.verse: So in Cana of Galilee Jesus did his first miracle. There he showed his glory, and his followers believed in him.

12.verse: Jesus in the Temple - After this, Jesus went to the town of Capernaum with his mother, brothers, and followers. They stayed there for just a few days.

13.verse: When it was almost time for the Jewish Passover Feast, Jesus went to Jerusalem.

14.verse: In the Temple he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves. He saw others sitting at tables, exchanging different kinds of money.

15.verse: Jesus made a whip out of cords and forced all of them, both the sheep and cattle, to leave the Temple. He turned over the tables and scattered the money of those who were exchanging it.

16.verse: Then he said to those who were selling pigeons, “Take these things out of here! Don’t make my Father’s house a place for buying and selling!”

17.verse: When this happened, the followers remembered what was written in the Scriptures: “My strong love for your Temple completely controls me.”

18.verse: Some of his people said to Jesus, “Show us a miracle to prove you have the right to do these things.”

19.verse: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and I will build it again in three days.”

20.verse: They answered, “It took forty-six years to build this Temple! Do you really believe you can build it again in three days?”

21.verse: (But the temple Jesus meant was his own body.

22.verse: After Jesus was raised from the dead, his followers remembered that Jesus had said this. Then they believed the Scripture and the words Jesus had said.)

23.verse: When Jesus was in Jerusalem for the Passover Feast, many people believed in him because they saw the miracles he did.

24.verse: But Jesus did not believe in them because he knew them all.

25.verse: He did not need anyone to tell him about people, because he knew what was in people’s minds.

1.verse: Nicodemus Comes to Jesus - There was a man named Nicodemus who was one of the Pharisees and an important Jewish leader.

2.verse: One night Nicodemus came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, we know you are a teacher sent from God, because no one can do the miracles you do unless God is with him.”

3.verse: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, unless you are born again, you cannot be in God’s kingdom.”

4.verse: Nicodemus said, “But if a person is already old, how can he be born again? He cannot enter his mother’s womb again. So how can a person be born a second time?”

5.verse: But Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, unless you are born from water and the Spirit, you cannot enter God’s kingdom.

6.verse: Human life comes from human parents, but spiritual life comes from the Spirit.

7.verse: Don’t be surprised when I tell you, ‘You must all be born again.’

8.verse: The wind blows where it wants to and you hear the sound of it, but you don’t know where the wind comes from or where it is going. It is the same with every person who is born from the Spirit.”

9.verse: Nicodemus asked, “How can this happen?”

10.verse: Jesus said, “You are an important teacher in Israel, and you don’t understand these things?

11.verse: I tell you the truth, we talk about what we know, and we tell about what we have seen, but you don’t accept what we tell you.

12.verse: I have told you about things here on earth, and you do not believe me. So you will not believe me if I tell you about things of heaven.

13.verse: The only one who has ever gone up to heaven is the One who came down from heaven—the Son of Man.

14.verse: “Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the desert, the Son of Man must also be lifted up.

15.verse: So that everyone who believes can have eternal life in him.

16.verse: “God loved the world so much that he gave his one and only Son so that whoever believes in him may not be lost, but have eternal life.

17.verse: God did not send his Son into the world to judge the world guilty, but to save the world through him.

18.verse: People who believe in God’s Son are not judged guilty. Those who do not believe have already been judged guilty, because they have not believed in God’s one and only Son.

19.verse: They are judged by this fact: The Light has come into the world, but they did not want light. They wanted darkness, because they were doing evil things.

20.verse: All who do evil hate the light and will not come to the light, because it will show all the evil things they do.

21.verse: But those who follow the true way come to the light, and it shows that the things they do were done through God.”

22.verse: Jesus and John the Baptist - After this, Jesus and his followers went into the area of Judea, where he stayed with his followers and baptized people.

23.verse: John was also baptizing in Aenon, near Salim, because there was plenty of water there. People were going there to be baptized.

24.verse: (This was before John was put into prison.)

25.verse: Some of John’s followers had an argument with a Jew about religious washing.

26.verse: So they came to John and said, “Teacher, remember the man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan River, the one you spoke about so much? He is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.”

27.verse: John answered, “A man can get only what God gives him.

28.verse: You yourselves heard me say, ‘I am not the Christ, but I am the one sent to prepare the way for him.’

29.verse: The bride belongs only to the bridegroom. But the friend who helps the bridegroom stands by and listens to him. He is thrilled that he gets to hear the bridegroom’s voice. In the same way, I am really happy.

30.verse: He must become greater, and I must become less important.

31.verse: The One Who Comes from Heaven - “The One who comes from above is greater than all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and talks about things on the earth. But the One who comes from heaven is greater than all.

32.verse: He tells what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts what he says.

33.verse: Whoever accepts what he says has proven that God is true.

34.verse: The One whom God sent speaks the words of God, because God gives him the Spirit fully.

35.verse: The Father loves the Son and has given him power over everything.

36.verse: Those who believe in the Son have eternal life, but those who do not obey the Son will never have life. God’s anger stays on them.”

1.verse: Jesus and a Samaritan Woman - The Pharisees heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more followers than John,

2.verse: although Jesus himself did not baptize people, but his followers did.

3.verse: Jesus knew that the Pharisees had heard about him, so he left Judea and went back to Galilee.

4.verse: But on the way he had to go through the country of Samaria.

5.verse: In Samaria Jesus came to the town called Sychar, which is near the field Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

6.verse: Jacob’s well was there. Jesus was tired from his long trip, so he sat down beside the well. It was about twelve o’clock noon.

7.verse: When a Samaritan woman came to the well to get some water, Jesus said to her, “Please give me a drink.”

8.verse: (This happened while Jesus’ followers were in town buying some food.)

9.verse: The woman said, “I am surprised that you ask me for a drink, since you are a Jewish man and I am a Samaritan woman.” (Jewish people are not friends with Samaritans.)

10.verse: Jesus said, “If you only knew the free gift of God and who it is that is asking you for water, you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”

11.verse: The woman said, “Sir, where will you get this living water? The well is very deep, and you have nothing to get water with.

12.verse: Are you greater than Jacob, our father, who gave us this well and drank from it himself along with his sons and flocks?”

13.verse: Jesus answered, “Everyone who drinks this water will be thirsty again,

14.verse: but whoever drinks the water I give will never be thirsty. The water I give will become a spring of water gushing up inside that person, giving eternal life.”

15.verse: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water so I will never be thirsty again and will not have to come back here to get more water.”

16.verse: Jesus told her, “Go get your husband and come back here.”

17.verse: The woman answered, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You are right to say you have no husband.

18.verse: Really you have had five husbands, and the man you live with now is not your husband. You told the truth.”

19.verse: The woman said, “Sir, I can see that you are a prophet.

20.verse: Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain, but you say that Jerusalem is the place where people must worship.”

21.verse: Jesus said, “Believe me, woman. The time is coming when neither in Jerusalem nor on this mountain will you actually worship the Father.

22.verse: You Samaritans worship something you don’t understand. We understand what we worship, because salvation comes from the Jews.

23.verse: The time is coming when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, and that time is here already. You see, the Father too is actively seeking such people to worship him.

24.verse: God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”

25.verse: The woman said, “I know that the Messiah is coming.” (Messiah is the One called Christ.) “When the Messiah comes, he will explain everything to us.”

26.verse: Then Jesus said, “I am he—I, the one talking to you.”

27.verse: Just then his followers came back from town and were surprised to see him talking with a woman. But none of them asked, “What do you want?” or “Why are you talking with her?”

28.verse: Then the woman left her water jar and went back to town. She said to the people,

29.verse: “Come and see a man who told me everything I ever did. Do you think he might be the Christ?”

30.verse: So the people left the town and went to see Jesus.

31.verse: Meanwhile, his followers were begging him, “Teacher, eat something.”

32.verse: But Jesus answered, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”

33.verse: So the followers asked themselves, “Did somebody already bring him food?”

34.verse: Jesus said, “My food is to do what the One who sent me wants me to do and to finish his work.

35.verse: You have a saying, ‘Four more months till harvest.’ But I tell you, open your eyes and look at the fields ready for harvest now.

36.verse: Already, the one who harvests is being paid and is gathering crops for eternal life. So the one who plants and the one who harvests celebrate at the same time.

37.verse: Here the saying is true, ‘One person plants, and another harvests.’

38.verse: I sent you to harvest a crop that you did not work on. Others did the work, and you get to finish up their work.”

39.verse: Many of the Samaritans in that town believed in Jesus because of what the woman said: “He told me everything I ever did.”

40.verse: When the Samaritans came to Jesus, they begged him to stay with them, so he stayed there two more days.

41.verse: And many more believed because of the things he said.

42.verse: They said to the woman, “First we believed in Jesus because of what you said, but now we believe because we heard him ourselves. We know that this man really is the Savior of the world.”

43.verse: Jesus Heals an Officer’s Son - Two days later, Jesus left and went to Galilee.

44.verse: (Jesus had said before that a prophet is not respected in his own country.)

45.verse: When Jesus arrived in Galilee, the people there welcomed him. They had seen all the things he did at the Passover Feast in Jerusalem, because they had been there, too.

46.verse: Jesus went again to visit Cana in Galilee where he had changed the water into wine. One of the king’s important officers lived in the city of Capernaum, and his son was sick.

47.verse: When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to Jesus and begged him to come to Capernaum and heal his son, because his son was almost dead.

48.verse: Jesus said to him, “You people must see signs and miracles before you will believe in me.”

49.verse: The officer said, “Sir, come before my child dies.”

50.verse: Jesus answered, “Go. Your son will live.” The man believed what Jesus told him and went home.

51.verse: On the way the man’s servants came and met him and told him, “Your son is alive.”

52.verse: The man asked, “What time did my son begin to get well?” They answered, “Yesterday at one o’clock the fever left him.”

53.verse: The father knew that one o’clock was the exact time that Jesus had said, “Your son will live.” So the man and all the people who lived in his house believed in Jesus.

54.verse: That was the second miracle Jesus did after coming from Judea to Galilee.

1.verse: Jesus Heals a Man at a Pool - Later Jesus went to Jerusalem for a special feast.

2.verse: In Jerusalem there is a pool with five covered porches, which is called Bethesda in the Hebrew language. This pool is near the Sheep Gate.

3.verse: Many sick people were lying on the porches beside the pool. Some were blind, some were crippled, and some were paralyzed [, and they waited for the water to move.

4.verse: Sometimes an angel of the Lord came down to the pool and stirred up the water. After the angel did this, the first person to go into the pool was healed from any sickness he had].

5.verse: A man was lying there who had been sick for thirty-eight years.

6.verse: When Jesus saw the man and knew that he had been sick for such a long time, Jesus asked him, “Do you want to be well?”

7.verse: The sick man answered, “Sir, there is no one to help me get into the pool when the water starts moving. While I am coming to the water, someone else always gets in before me.”

8.verse: Then Jesus said, “Stand up. Pick up your mat and walk.”

9.verse: And immediately the man was well; he picked up his mat and began to walk. The day this happened was a Sabbath day.

10.verse: So the Jews said to the man who had been healed, “Today is the Sabbath. It is against our law for you to carry your mat on the Sabbath day.”

11.verse: But he answered, “The man who made me well told me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’ ”

12.verse: Then they asked him, “Who is the man who told you to pick up your mat and walk?”

13.verse: But the man who had been healed did not know who it was, because there were many people in that place, and Jesus had left.

14.verse: Later, Jesus found the man at the Temple and said to him, “See, you are well now. Stop sinning so that something worse does not happen to you.”

15.verse: Then the man left and told his people that Jesus was the one who had made him well.

16.verse: Because Jesus was doing this on the Sabbath day, some evil people began to persecute him.

17.verse: But Jesus said to them, “My Father never stops working, and so I keep working, too.”

18.verse: This made them try still harder to kill him. They said, “First Jesus was breaking the law about the Sabbath day. Now he says that God is his own Father, making himself equal with God!”

19.verse: Jesus Has God’s Authority - But Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, the Son can do nothing alone. The Son does only what he sees the Father doing, because the Son does whatever the Father does.

20.verse: The Father loves the Son and shows the Son all the things he himself does. But the Father will show the Son even greater things than this so that you can all be amazed.

21.verse: Just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so also the Son gives life to those he wants to.

22.verse: In fact, the Father judges no one, but he has given the Son power to do all the judging

23.verse: so that all people will honor the Son as much as they honor the Father. Anyone who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.

24.verse: “I tell you the truth, whoever hears what I say and believes in the One who sent me has eternal life. That person will not be judged guilty but has already left death and entered life.

25.verse: I tell you the truth, the time is coming and is already here when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will have life.

26.verse: Life comes from the Father himself, and he has allowed the Son to have life in himself as well.

27.verse: And the Father has given the Son the approval to judge, because he is the Son of Man.

28.verse: Don’t be surprised at this: A time is coming when all who are dead and in their graves will hear his voice.

29.verse: Then they will come out of their graves. Those who did good will rise and have life forever, but those who did evil will rise to be judged guilty.

30.verse: Jesus Is God’s Son - “I can do nothing alone. I judge only the way I am told, so my judgment is fair. I don’t try to please myself, but I try to please the One who sent me.

31.verse: “If only I tell people about myself, what I say is not true.

32.verse: But there is another who tells about me, and I know that the things he says about me are true.

33.verse: “You have sent people to John, and he has told you the truth.

34.verse: It is not that I need what humans say; I tell you this so you can be saved.

35.verse: John was like a burning and shining lamp, and you were happy to enjoy his light for a while.

36.verse: “But I have a proof about myself that is greater than that of John. The things I do, which are the things my Father gave me to do, prove that the Father sent me.

37.verse: And the Father himself who sent me has given proof about me. You have never heard his voice or seen what he looks like.

38.verse: His teaching does not live in you, because you don’t believe in the One the Father sent.

39.verse: You carefully study the Scriptures because you think they give you eternal life. They do in fact tell about me,

40.verse: but you refuse to come to me to have that life.

42.verse: But I know you—I know that you don’t have God’s love in you.

43.verse: I have come from my Father and speak for him, but you don’t accept me. But when another person comes, speaking only for himself, you will accept him.

44.verse: You try to get praise from each other, but you do not try to get the praise that comes from the only God. So how can you believe?

45.verse: Don’t think that I will stand before the Father and say you are wrong. The one who says you are wrong is Moses, the one you hoped would save you.

46.verse: If you really believed Moses, you would believe me, because Moses wrote about me.

47.verse: But if you don’t believe what Moses wrote, how can you believe what I say?”

1.verse: More than Five Thousand Fed - After this, Jesus went across Lake Galilee (or, Lake Tiberias).

2.verse: Many people followed him because they saw the miracles he did to heal the sick.

3.verse: Jesus went up on a hill and sat down there with his followers.

4.verse: It was almost the time for the Jewish Passover Feast.

5.verse: When Jesus looked up and saw a large crowd coming toward him, he said to Philip, “Where can we buy enough bread for all these people to eat?”

6.verse: (Jesus asked Philip this question to test him, because Jesus already knew what he planned to do.)

7.verse: Philip answered, “Someone would have to work almost a year to buy enough bread for each person to have only a little piece.”

8.verse: Another one of his followers, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said,

9.verse: “Here is a boy with five loaves of barley bread and two little fish, but that is not enough for so many people.”

10.verse: Jesus said, “Tell the people to sit down.” There was plenty of grass there, and about five thousand men sat down there.

11.verse: Then Jesus took the loaves of bread, thanked God for them, and gave them to the people who were sitting there. He did the same with the fish, giving as much as the people wanted.

12.verse: When they had all had enough to eat, Jesus said to his followers, “Gather the leftover pieces of fish and bread so that nothing is wasted.”

13.verse: So they gathered up the pieces and filled twelve baskets with the pieces left from the five barley loaves.

14.verse: When the people saw this miracle that Jesus did, they said, “He must truly be the Prophet who is coming into the world.”

15.verse: Jesus knew that the people planned to come and take him by force and make him their king, so he left and went into the hills alone.

16.verse: Jesus Walks on the Water - That evening Jesus’ followers went down to Lake Galilee.

17.verse: It was dark now, and Jesus had not yet come to them. The followers got into a boat and started across the lake to Capernaum.

18.verse: By now a strong wind was blowing, and the waves on the lake were getting bigger.

19.verse: When they had rowed the boat about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the water, coming toward the boat. The followers were afraid,

20.verse: but Jesus said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”

21.verse: Then they were glad to take him into the boat. At once the boat came to land at the place where they wanted to go.

22.verse: The People Seek Jesus - The next day the people who had stayed on the other side of the lake knew that Jesus had not gone in the boat with his followers but that they had left without him. And they knew that only one boat had been there.

23.verse: But then some boats came from Tiberias and landed near the place where the people had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

24.verse: When the people saw that Jesus and his followers were not there now, they got into boats and went to Capernaum to find Jesus.

25.verse: Jesus, the Bread of Life - When the people found Jesus on the other side of the lake, they asked him, “Teacher, when did you come here?”

26.verse: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, you aren’t looking for me because you saw me do miracles. You are looking for me because you ate the bread and were satisfied.

27.verse: Don’t work for the food that spoils. Work for the food that stays good always and gives eternal life. The Son of Man will give you this food, because on him God the Father has put his power.”

28.verse: The people asked Jesus, “What are the things God wants us to do?”

29.verse: Jesus answered, “The work God wants you to do is this: Believe the One he sent.”

30.verse: So the people asked, “What miracle will you do? If we see a miracle, we will believe you. What will you do?

31.verse: Our ancestors ate the manna in the desert. This is written in the Scriptures: ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”

32.verse: Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, it was not Moses who gave you bread from heaven; it is my Father who is giving you the true bread from heaven.

33.verse: God’s bread is the One who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”

34.verse: The people said, “Sir, give us this bread always.”

35.verse: Then Jesus said, “I am the bread that gives life. Whoever comes to me will never be hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.

36.verse: But as I told you before, you have seen me and still don’t believe.

37.verse: The Father gives me the people who are mine. Every one of them will come to me, and I will always accept them.

38.verse: I came down from heaven to do what God wants me to do, not what I want to do.

39.verse: Here is what the One who sent me wants me to do: I must not lose even one whom God gave me, but I must raise them all on the last day.

40.verse: Those who see the Son and believe in him have eternal life, and I will raise them on the last day. This is what my Father wants.”

41.verse: Some people began to complain about Jesus because he said, “I am the bread that comes down from heaven.”

42.verse: They said, “This is Jesus, the son of Joseph. We know his father and mother. How can he say, ‘I came down from heaven’?”

43.verse: But Jesus answered, “Stop complaining to each other.

44.verse: The Father is the One who sent me. No one can come to me unless the Father draws him to me, and I will raise that person up on the last day.

45.verse: It is written in the prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who listens to the Father and learns from him comes to me.

46.verse: No one has seen the Father except the One who is from God; only he has seen the Father.

47.verse: I tell you the truth, whoever believes has eternal life.

48.verse: I am the bread that gives life.

49.verse: Your ancestors ate the manna in the desert, but still they died.

50.verse: Here is the bread that comes down from heaven. Anyone who eats this bread will never die.

51.verse: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. Anyone who eats this bread will live forever. This bread is my flesh, which I will give up so that the world may have life.”

52.verse: Then the evil people began to argue among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”

53.verse: Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, you must eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood. Otherwise, you won’t have real life in you.

54.verse: Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood have eternal life, and I will raise them up on the last day.

55.verse: My flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.

56.verse: Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood live in me, and I live in them.

57.verse: The living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father. So whoever eats me will live because of me.

58.verse: I am not like the bread your ancestors ate. They ate that bread and still died. I am the bread that came down from heaven, and whoever eats this bread will live forever.”

59.verse: Jesus said all these things while he was teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.

60.verse: The Words of Eternal Life - When the followers of Jesus heard this, many of them said, “This teaching is hard. Who can accept it?”

61.verse: Knowing that his followers were complaining about this, Jesus said, “Does this teaching bother you?

62.verse: Then will it also bother you to see the Son of Man going back to the place where he came from?

63.verse: It is the Spirit that gives life. The flesh doesn’t give life. The words I told you are spirit, and they give life.

64.verse: But some of you don’t believe.” (Jesus knew from the beginning who did not believe and who would turn against him.)

65.verse: Jesus said, “That is the reason I said, ‘If the Father does not bring a person to me, that one cannot come.’”

66.verse: After Jesus said this, many of his followers left him and stopped following him.

67.verse: Jesus asked the twelve followers, “Do you want to leave, too?”

68.verse: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, who would we go to? You have the words that give eternal life.

69.verse: We believe and know that you are the Holy One from God.”

70.verse: Then Jesus answered, “I chose all twelve of you, but one of you is a devil.”

71.verse: Jesus was talking about Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot. Judas was one of the twelve, but later he was going to turn against Jesus.

1.verse: Jesus’ Brothers Don’t Believe - After this, Jesus traveled around Galilee. He did not want to travel in Judea, because some evil people there wanted to kill him.

2.verse: It was time for the Feast of Shelters.

3.verse: So Jesus’ brothers said to him, “You should leave here and go to Judea so your followers there can see the miracles you do.

4.verse: Anyone who wants to be well known does not hide what he does. If you are doing these things, show yourself to the world.”

5.verse: (Even Jesus’ brothers did not believe in him.)

6.verse: Jesus said to his brothers, “The right time for me has not yet come, but any time is right for you.

7.verse: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, because I tell it the evil things it does.

8.verse: So you go to the feast. I will not go yet to this feast, because the right time for me has not yet come.”

9.verse: After saying this, Jesus stayed in Galilee.

10.verse: But after Jesus’ brothers had gone to the feast, Jesus went also. But he did not let people see him.

11.verse: At the feast some people were looking for him and saying, “Where is that man?”

12.verse: Within the large crowd there, many people were whispering to each other about Jesus. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others said, “No, he fools the people.”

13.verse: But no one was brave enough to talk about Jesus openly, because they were afraid of the elders.

14.verse: Jesus Teaches at the Feast - When the feast was about half over, Jesus went to the Temple and began to teach.

15.verse: The people were amazed and said, “This man has never studied in school. How did he learn so much?”

16.verse: Jesus answered, “The things I teach are not my own, but they come from him who sent me.

17.verse: If people choose to do what God wants, they will know that my teaching comes from God and not from me.

18.verse: Those who teach their own ideas are trying to get honor for themselves. But those who try to bring honor to the one who sent them speak the truth, and there is nothing false in them.

19.verse: Moses gave you the law, but none of you obeys that law. Why are you trying to kill me?”

20.verse: The people answered, “A demon has come into you. We are not trying to kill you.”

21.verse: Jesus said to them, “I did one miracle, and you are all amazed.

22.verse: Moses gave you the law about circumcision. (But really Moses did not give you circumcision; it came from our ancestors.) And yet you circumcise a baby boy on a Sabbath day.

23.verse: If a baby boy can be circumcised on a Sabbath day to obey the law of Moses, why are you angry at me for healing a person’s whole body on the Sabbath day?

24.verse: Stop judging by the way things look, but judge by what is really right.”

25.verse: Is Jesus the Christ? - Then some of the people who lived in Jerusalem said, “This is the man they are trying to kill.

26.verse: But he is teaching where everyone can see and hear him, and no one is trying to stop him. Maybe the leaders have decided he really is the Christ.

27.verse: But we know where this man is from. Yet when the real Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”

28.verse: Jesus, teaching in the Temple, cried out, “Yes, you know me, and you know where I am from. But I have not come by my own authority. I was sent by the One who is true, whom you don’t know.

29.verse: But I know him, because I am from him, and he sent me.”

30.verse: When Jesus said this, they tried to seize him. But no one was able to touch him, because it was not yet the right time.

31.verse: But many of the people believed in Jesus. They said, “When the Christ comes, will he do more miracles than this man has done?”

32.verse: The Leaders Try to Arrest Jesus - The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering these things about Jesus. So the leading priests and the Pharisees sent some Temple guards to arrest him.

33.verse: Jesus said, “I will be with you a little while longer. Then I will go back to the One who sent me.

34.verse: You will look for me, but you will not find me. And you cannot come where I am.”

35.verse: Some people said to each other, “Where will this man go so we cannot find him? Will he go to the Greek cities where our people live and teach the Greek people there?

36.verse: What did he mean when he said, ‘You will look for me, but you will not find me,’ and ‘You cannot come where I am’?”

37.verse: Jesus Talks About the Spirit - On the last and most important day of the feast Jesus stood up and said in a loud voice, “Let anyone who is thirsty come to me and drink.

38.verse: If anyone believes in me, rivers of living water will flow out from that person’s heart, as the Scripture says.”

39.verse: Jesus was talking about the Holy Spirit. The Spirit had not yet been given, because Jesus had not yet been raised to glory. But later, those who believed in Jesus would receive the Spirit.

40.verse: The People Argue About Jesus - When the people heard Jesus’ words, some of them said, “This man really is the Prophet.”

41.verse: Others said, “He is the Christ.” Still others said, “The Christ will not come from Galilee.

42.verse: The Scripture says that the Christ will come from David’s family and from Bethlehem, the town where David lived.”

43.verse: So the people did not agree with each other about Jesus.

44.verse: Some of them wanted to arrest him, but no one was able to touch him.

45.verse: Some Leaders Won’t Believe - The Temple guards went back to the leading priests and the Pharisees, who asked, “Why didn’t you bring Jesus?”

46.verse: The guards answered, “The words he says are greater than the words of any other person who has ever spoken!”

47.verse: The Pharisees answered, “So Jesus has fooled you also!

48.verse: Have any of the leaders or the Pharisees believed in him? No!

49.verse: But these people, who know nothing about the law, are under God’s curse.”

50.verse: Nicodemus, who had gone to see Jesus before, was in that group. He said,

51.verse: “Our law does not judge a person without hearing him and knowing what he has done.”

52.verse: They answered, “Are you from Galilee, too? Study the Scriptures, and you will learn that no prophet comes from Galilee.”

53.verse: Some of the earliest surviving Greek copies do not contain 7:53—8:11.[ And everyone left and went home.

1.verse: The Woman Caught in Adultery - Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.

2.verse: But early in the morning he went back to the Temple, and all the people came to him, and he sat and taught them.

3.verse: The teachers of the law and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in adultery. They forced her to stand before the people.

4.verse: They said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught having sexual relations with a man who is not her husband.

5.verse: The law of Moses commands that we stone to death every woman who does this. What do you say we should do?”

6.verse: They were asking this to trick Jesus so that they could have some charge against him. But Jesus bent over and started writing on the ground with his finger.

7.verse: When they continued to ask Jesus their question, he raised up and said, “Anyone here who has never sinned can throw the first stone at her.”

8.verse: Then Jesus bent over again and wrote on the ground.

9.verse: Those who heard Jesus began to leave one by one, first the older men and then the others. Jesus was left there alone with the woman standing before him.

10.verse: Jesus raised up again and asked her, “Woman, where are they? Has no one judged you guilty?”

11.verse: She answered, “No one, sir.” Then Jesus said, “I also don’t judge you guilty. You may go now, but don’t sin anymore.”]

12.verse: Jesus Is the Light of the World - Later, Jesus talked to the people again, saying, “I am the light of the world. The person who follows me will never live in darkness but will have the light that gives life.”

13.verse: The Pharisees said to Jesus, “When you talk about yourself, you are the only one to say these things are true. We cannot accept what you say.”

14.verse: Jesus answered, “Yes, I am saying these things about myself, but they are true. I know where I came from and where I am going. But you don’t know where I came from or where I am going.

15.verse: You judge by human standards. I am not judging anyone.

16.verse: But when I do judge, I judge truthfully, because I am not alone. The Father who sent me is with me.

17.verse: Your own law says that when two witnesses say the same thing, you must accept what they say.

18.verse: I am one of the witnesses who speaks about myself, and the Father who sent me is the other witness.”

19.verse: They asked, “Where is your father?” Jesus answered, “You don’t know me or my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father, too.”

20.verse: Jesus said these things while he was teaching in the Temple, near where the money is kept. But no one arrested him, because the right time for him had not yet come.

21.verse: The People Misunderstand Jesus - Again, Jesus said to the people, “I will leave you, and you will look for me, but you will die in your sins. You cannot come where I am going.”

22.verse: So the Jews asked, “Will he kill himself? Is that why he said, ‘You cannot come where I am going’?”

23.verse: Jesus said, “You people are from here below, but I am from above. You belong to this world, but I don’t belong to this world.

24.verse: So I told you that you would die in your sins. Yes, you will die in your sins if you don’t believe that I am he.”

25.verse: They asked, “Then who are you?” Jesus answered, “I am what I have told you from the beginning.

26.verse: I have many things to say and decide about you. But I tell people only the things I have heard from the One who sent me, and he speaks the truth.”

27.verse: The people did not understand that he was talking to them about the Father.

28.verse: So Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, you will know that I am he. You will know that these things I do are not by my own authority but that I say only what the Father has taught me.

29.verse: The One who sent me is with me. I always do what is pleasing to him, so he has not left me alone.”

30.verse: While Jesus was saying these things, many people believed in him.

31.verse: Freedom from Sin - So Jesus said to the Jews who believed in him, “If you continue to obey my teaching, you are truly my followers.

32.verse: Then you will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”

33.verse: They answered, “We are Abraham’s children, and we have never been anyone’s slaves. So why do you say we will be free?”

34.verse: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, everyone who lives in sin is a slave to sin.

35.verse: A slave does not stay with a family forever, but a son belongs to the family forever.

36.verse: So if the Son makes you free, you will be truly free.

37.verse: I know you are Abraham’s children, but you want to kill me because you don’t accept my teaching.

38.verse: I am telling you what my Father has shown me, but you do what your father has told you.”

39.verse: They answered, “Our father is Abraham.” Jesus said, “If you were really Abraham’s children, you would do the things Abraham did.

40.verse: I am a man who has told you the truth which I heard from God, but you are trying to kill me. Abraham did nothing like that.

41.verse: So you are doing the things your own father did.” But they said, “We are not like children who never knew who their father was. God is our Father; he is the only Father we have.”

42.verse: Jesus said to them, “If God were really your Father, you would love me, because I came from God and now I am here. I did not come by my own authority; God sent me.

43.verse: You don’t understand what I say, because you cannot accept my teaching.

44.verse: You belong to your father the devil, and you want to do what he wants. He was a murderer from the beginning and was against the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he tells a lie, he shows what he is really like, because he is a liar and the father of lies.

45.verse: But because I speak the truth, you don’t believe me.

46.verse: Can any of you prove that I am guilty of sin? If I am telling the truth, why don’t you believe me?

47.verse: The person who belongs to God accepts what God says. But you don’t accept what God says, because you don’t belong to God.”

48.verse: Jesus Is Greater than Abraham - They answered, “We say you are a Samaritan and have a demon in you. Are we not right?”

49.verse: Jesus answered, “I have no demon in me. I give honor to my Father, but you dishonor me.

50.verse: I am not trying to get honor for myself. There is One who wants this honor for me, and he is the judge.

51.verse: I tell you the truth, whoever obeys my teaching will never die.”

52.verse: They said to Jesus, “Now we know that you have a demon in you! Even Abraham and the prophets died. But you say, ‘Whoever obeys my teaching will never die.’

53.verse: Do you think you are greater than our father Abraham, who died? And the prophets died, too. Who do you think you are?”

54.verse: Jesus answered, “If I give honor to myself, that honor is worth nothing. The One who gives me honor is my Father, and you say he is your God.

55.verse: You don’t really know him, but I know him. If I said I did not know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him, and I obey what he says.

56.verse: Your father Abraham was very happy that he would see my day. He saw that day and was glad.”

57.verse: They said to him, “You have never seen Abraham! You are not even fifty years old.”

58.verse: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, before Abraham was even born, I am!”

59.verse: When Jesus said this, the people picked up stones to throw at him. But Jesus hid himself, and then he left the Temple.

1.verse: Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind - As Jesus was walking along, he saw a man who had been born blind.

2.verse: His followers asked him, “Teacher, whose sin caused this man to be born blind—his own sin or his parents’ sin?”

3.verse: Jesus answered, “It is not this man’s sin or his parents’ sin that made him blind. This man was born blind so that God’s power could be shown in him.

4.verse: While it is daytime, we must continue doing the work of the One who sent me. Night is coming, when no one can work.

5.verse: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”

6.verse: After Jesus said this, he spit on the ground and made some mud with it and put the mud on the man’s eyes.

7.verse: Then he told the man, “Go and wash in the Pool of Siloam.” (Siloam means Sent.) So the man went, washed, and came back seeing.

8.verse: The neighbors and some people who had earlier seen this man begging said, “Isn’t this the same man who used to sit and beg?”

9.verse: Some said, “He is the one,” but others said, “No, he only looks like him.” The man himself said, “I am the man.”

10.verse: They asked, “How did you get your sight?”

11.verse: He answered, “The man named Jesus made some mud and put it on my eyes. Then he told me to go to Siloam and wash. So I went and washed, and then I could see.”

12.verse: They asked him, “Where is this man?” “I don’t know,” he answered.

13.verse: Pharisees Question the Healing - Then the people took to the Pharisees the man who had been blind.

14.verse: The day Jesus had made mud and healed his eyes was a Sabbath day.

15.verse: So now the Pharisees asked the man, “How did you get your sight?” He answered, “He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and now I see.”

16.verse: So some of the Pharisees were saying, “This man does not keep the Sabbath day, so he is not from God.” But others said, “A man who is a sinner can’t do miracles like these.” So they could not agree with each other.

17.verse: They asked the man again, “What do you say about him since it was your eyes he opened?” The man answered, “He is a prophet.”

18.verse: These leaders did not believe that he had been blind and could now see again. So they sent for the man’s parents

19.verse: and asked them, “Is this your son who you say was born blind? Then how does he now see?”

20.verse: His parents answered, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.

21.verse: But we don’t know how he can now see. We don’t know who opened his eyes. Ask him. He is old enough to speak for himself.”

22.verse: His parents said this because they were afraid of the elders, who had already decided that anyone who said Jesus was the Christ would be avoided.

23.verse: That is why his parents said, “He is old enough. Ask him.”

24.verse: So for the second time, they called the man who had been blind. They said, “You should give God the glory by telling the truth. We know that this man is a sinner.”

25.verse: He answered, “I don’t know if he is a sinner. One thing I do know: I was blind, and now I see.”

26.verse: They asked, “What did he do to you? How did he make you see again?”

27.verse: He answered, “I already told you, and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become his followers, too?”

28.verse: Then they insulted him and said, “You are his follower, but we are followers of Moses.

29.verse: We know that God spoke to Moses, but we don’t even know where this man comes from.”

30.verse: The man answered, “This is a very strange thing. You don’t know where he comes from, and yet he opened my eyes.

31.verse: We all know that God does not listen to sinners, but he listens to anyone who worships and obeys him.

32.verse: Nobody has ever heard of anyone giving sight to a man born blind.

33.verse: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”

34.verse: They answered, “You were born full of sin! Are you trying to teach us?” And they threw him out.

35.verse: Spiritual Blindness - When Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, Jesus found him and said, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”

36.verse: He asked, “Who is the Son of Man, sir, so that I can believe in him?”

37.verse: Jesus said to him, “You have seen him. The Son of Man is the one talking with you.”

38.verse: He said, “Lord, I believe!” Then the man worshiped Jesus.

39.verse: Jesus said, “I came into this world so that the world could be judged. I came so that the blind would see and so that those who see will become blind.”

40.verse: Some of the Pharisees who were nearby heard Jesus say this and asked, “Are you saying we are blind, too?”

41.verse: Jesus said, “If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin. But since you keep saying you see, your guilt remains.”

1.verse: The Shepherd and His Sheep - Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, the person who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs in some other way, is a thief and a robber.

2.verse: The one who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.verse: The one who guards the door opens it for him. And the sheep listen to the voice of the shepherd. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

4.verse: When he brings all his sheep out, he goes ahead of them, and they follow him because they know his voice.

5.verse: But they will never follow a stranger. They will run away from him because they don’t know his voice.”

6.verse: Jesus told the people this story, but they did not understand what it meant.

7.verse: Jesus Is the Good Shepherd - So Jesus said again, “I tell you the truth, I am the door for the sheep.

8.verse: All the people who came before me were thieves and robbers. The sheep did not listen to them.

9.verse: I am the door, and the person who enters through me will be saved and will be able to come in and go out and find pasture.

10.verse: A thief comes to steal and kill and destroy, but I came to give life—life in all its fullness.

11.verse: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives his life for the sheep.

12.verse: The worker who is paid to keep the sheep is different from the shepherd who owns them. When the worker sees a wolf coming, he runs away and leaves the sheep alone. Then the wolf attacks the sheep and scatters them.

13.verse: The man runs away because he is only a paid worker and does not really care about the sheep.

14.verse: “I am the good shepherd. I know my sheep, and my sheep know me,

15.verse: just as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I give my life for the sheep.

16.verse: I have other sheep that are not in this flock, and I must bring them also. They will listen to my voice, and there will be one flock and one shepherd.

17.verse: The Father loves me because I give my life so that I can take it back again.

18.verse: No one takes it away from me; I give my own life freely. I have the right to give my life, and I have the right to take it back. This is what my Father commanded me to do.”

19.verse: Again the leaders did not agree with each other because of these words of Jesus.

20.verse: Many of them said, “A demon has come into him and made him crazy. Why listen to him?”

21.verse: But others said, “A man who is crazy with a demon does not say things like this. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”

22.verse: Jesus Is Rejected - The time came for the Feast of Dedication at Jerusalem. It was winter,

23.verse: and Jesus was walking in the Temple in Solomon’s Porch.

24.verse: Some people gathered around him and said, “How long will you make us wonder about you? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

25.verse: Jesus answered, “I told you already, but you did not believe. The miracles I do in my Father’s name show who I am.

26.verse: But you don’t believe, because you are not my sheep.

27.verse: My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.

28.verse: I give them eternal life, and they will never die, and no one can steal them out of my hand.

29.verse: My Father gave my sheep to me. He is greater than all, and no person can steal my sheep out of my Father’s hand.

30.verse: The Father and I are one.”

31.verse: Again some of the people picked up stones to kill Jesus.

32.verse: But he said to them, “I have done many good works from the Father. Which of these good works are you killing me for?”

33.verse: They answered, “We are not killing you because of any good work you did, but because you speak against God. You are only a human, but you say you are the same as God!”

34.verse: Jesus answered, “It is written in your law that God said, ‘I said, you are gods.’

35.verse: This Scripture called those people gods who received God’s message, and Scripture is always true.

36.verse: So why do you say that I speak against God because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’? I am the one God chose and sent into the world.

37.verse: If I don’t do what my Father does, then don’t believe me.

38.verse: But if I do what my Father does, even though you don’t believe in me, believe what I do. Then you will know and understand that the Father is in me and I am in the Father.”

39.verse: They tried to take Jesus again, but he escaped from them.

40.verse: Then he went back across the Jordan River to the place where John had first baptized. Jesus stayed there,

41.verse: and many people came to him and said, “John never did a miracle, but everything John said about this man is true.”

42.verse: And in that place many believed in Jesus.

1.verse: The Death of Lazarus - A man named Lazarus was sick. He lived in the town of Bethany, where Mary and her sister Martha lived.

2.verse: Mary was the woman who later put perfume on the Lord and wiped his feet with her hair. Mary’s brother was Lazarus, the man who was now sick.

3.verse: So Mary and Martha sent someone to tell Jesus, “Lord, the one you love is sick.”

4.verse: When Jesus heard this, he said, “This sickness will not end in death. It is for the glory of God, to bring glory to the Son of God.”

5.verse: Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.

6.verse: But when he heard that Lazarus was sick, he stayed where he was for two more days.

7.verse: Then Jesus said to his followers, “Let’s go back to Judea.”

8.verse: The followers said, “But Teacher, some people there tried to stone you to death only a short time ago. Now you want to go back there?”

9.verse: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the daylight, he will not stumble, because he can see by this world’s light.

10.verse: But if anyone walks at night, he stumbles because there is no light to help him see.”

11.verse: After Jesus said this, he added, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going there to wake him.”

12.verse: The followers said, “But Lord, if he is only asleep, he will be all right.”

13.verse: Jesus meant that Lazarus was dead, but his followers thought he meant Lazarus was really sleeping.

14.verse: So then Jesus said plainly, “Lazarus is dead.

15.verse: And I am glad for your sakes I was not there so that you may believe. But let’s go to him now.”

16.verse: Then Thomas (the one called Didymus) said to the other followers, “Let us also go so that we can die with him.”

17.verse: Jesus in Bethany - When Jesus arrived, he learned that Lazarus had already been dead and in the tomb for four days.

18.verse: Bethany was about two miles from Jerusalem.

19.verse: Many of the Jews had come there to comfort Martha and Mary about their brother.

20.verse: When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary stayed home.

21.verse: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.

22.verse: But I know that even now God will give you anything you ask.”

23.verse: Jesus said, “Your brother will rise and live again.”

24.verse: Martha answered, “I know that he will rise and live again in the resurrection on the last day.”

25.verse: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in me will have life even if they die.

26.verse: And everyone who lives and believes in me will never die. Martha, do you believe this?”

27.verse: Martha answered, “Yes, Lord. I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God, the One coming to the world.”

28.verse: Jesus Cries - After Martha said this, she went back and talked to her sister Mary alone. Martha said, “The Teacher is here and he is asking for you.”

29.verse: When Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to Jesus.

30.verse: Jesus had not yet come into the town but was still at the place where Martha had met him.

31.verse: The Jews were with Mary in the house, comforting her. When they saw her stand and leave quickly, they followed her, thinking she was going to the tomb to cry there.

32.verse: But Mary went to the place where Jesus was. When she saw him, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”

33.verse: When Jesus saw Mary crying and the Jews who came with her also crying, he was upset and was deeply troubled.

34.verse: He asked, “Where did you bury him?” “Come and see, Lord,” they said.

36.verse: So the Jews said, “See how much he loved him.”

37.verse: But some of them said, “If Jesus opened the eyes of the blind man, why couldn’t he keep Lazarus from dying?”

38.verse: Jesus Raises Lazarus - Again feeling very upset, Jesus came to the tomb. It was a cave with a large stone covering the entrance.

39.verse: Jesus said, “Move the stone away.” Martha, the sister of the dead man, said, “But, Lord, it has been four days since he died. There will be a bad smell.”

40.verse: Then Jesus said to her, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believed you would see the glory of God?”

41.verse: So they moved the stone away from the entrance. Then Jesus looked up and said, “Father, I thank you that you heard me.

42.verse: I know that you always hear me, but I said these things because of the people here around me. I want them to believe that you sent me.”

43.verse: After Jesus said this, he cried out in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”

44.verse: The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with pieces of cloth, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them, “Take the cloth off of him and let him go.”

45.verse: The Plan to Kill Jesus - Many of the people, who had come to visit Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him.

46.verse: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.

47.verse: Then the leading priests and Pharisees called a meeting of the council. They asked, “What should we do? This man is doing many miracles.

48.verse: If we let him continue doing these things, everyone will believe in him. Then the Romans will come and take away our Temple and our nation.”

49.verse: One of the men there was Caiaphas, the high priest that year. He said, “You people know nothing!

50.verse: You don’t realize that it is better for one man to die for the people than for the whole nation to be destroyed.”

51.verse: Caiaphas did not think of this himself. As high priest that year, he was really prophesying that Jesus would die for their nation

52.verse: and for God’s scattered children to bring them all together and make them one.

53.verse: That day they started planning to kill Jesus.

54.verse: So Jesus no longer traveled openly among the people. He left there and went to a place near the desert, to a town called Ephraim and stayed there with his followers.

55.verse: It was almost time for the Passover Feast. Many from the country went up to Jerusalem before the Passover to do the special things to make themselves pure.

56.verse: The people looked for Jesus and stood in the Temple asking each other, “Is he coming to the Feast? What do you think?”

57.verse: But the leading priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where Jesus was, he must tell them. Then they could arrest him.

1.verse: Jesus with Friends in Bethany - Six days before the Passover Feast, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus lived. (Lazarus is the man Jesus raised from the dead.)

2.verse: There they had a dinner for Jesus. Martha served the food, and Lazarus was one of the people eating with Jesus.

3.verse: Mary brought in a pint of very expensive perfume made from pure nard. She poured the perfume on Jesus’ feet, and then she wiped his feet with her hair. And the sweet smell from the perfume filled the whole house.

4.verse: Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ followers who would later turn against him, was there. Judas said,

5.verse: “This perfume was worth an entire year’s wages. Why wasn’t it sold and the money given to the poor?”

6.verse: But Judas did not really care about the poor; he said this because he was a thief. He was the one who kept the money box, and he often stole from it.

7.verse: Jesus answered, “Leave her alone. It was right for her to save this perfume for today, the day for me to be prepared for burial.

8.verse: You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.”

9.verse: The Plot Against Lazarus - A large crowd of people heard that Jesus was in Bethany. So they went there to see not only Jesus but Lazarus, whom Jesus raised from the dead.

10.verse: So the leading priests made plans to kill Lazarus, too.

11.verse: Because of Lazarus many of the Jews were leaving them and believing in Jesus.

12.verse: Jesus Enters Jerusalem - The next day a great crowd who had come to Jerusalem for the Passover Feast heard that Jesus was coming there.

13.verse: So they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet Jesus, shouting, “Praise God! God bless the One who comes in the name of the Lord! God bless the King of Israel!” Psalm 118:25–26

14.verse: Jesus found a colt and sat on it. This was as the Scripture says,

15.verse: “Don’t be afraid, people of Jerusalem! Your king is coming, sitting on the colt of a donkey.” Zechariah 9:9

16.verse: The followers of Jesus did not understand this at first. But after Jesus was raised to glory, they remembered that this had been written about him and that they had done these things to him.

17.verse: People Tell About Jesus - There had been many people with Jesus when he raised Lazarus from the dead and told him to come out of the tomb. Now they were telling others about what Jesus did.

18.verse: Many people went out to meet Jesus, because they had heard about this miracle.

19.verse: So the Pharisees said to each other, “You can see that nothing is going right for us. Look! The whole world is following him.”

20.verse: Jesus Talks About His Death - There were some Greek people, too, who came to Jerusalem to worship at the Passover Feast.

21.verse: They went to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and said, “Sir, we would like to see Jesus.”

22.verse: Philip told Andrew, and then Andrew and Philip told Jesus.

23.verse: Jesus said to them, “The time has come for the Son of Man to receive his glory.

24.verse: I tell you the truth, a grain of wheat must fall to the ground and die to make many seeds. But if it never dies, it remains only a single seed.

25.verse: Those who love their lives will lose them, but those who hate their lives in this world will keep true life forever.

26.verse: Whoever serves me must follow me. Then my servant will be with me everywhere I am. My Father will honor anyone who serves me.

27.verse: “Now I am very troubled. Should I say, ‘Father, save me from this time’? No, I came to this time so I could suffer.

28.verse: Father, bring glory to your name!” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have brought glory to it, and I will do it again.”

29.verse: The crowd standing there, who heard the voice, said it was thunder. But others said, “An angel has spoken to him.”

30.verse: Jesus said, “That voice was for your sake, not mine.

31.verse: Now is the time for the world to be judged; now the ruler of this world will be thrown down.

32.verse: If I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw all people toward me.”

33.verse: Jesus said this to show how he would die.

34.verse: The crowd said, “We have heard from the law that the Christ will live forever. So why do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this ‘Son of Man’?”

35.verse: Then Jesus said, “The light will be with you for a little longer, so walk while you have the light. Then the darkness will not catch you. If you walk in the darkness, you will not know where you are going.

36.verse: Believe in the light while you still have it so that you will become children of light.” When Jesus had said this, he left and hid himself from them.

37.verse: Some People Won’t Believe in Jesus - Though Jesus had done many miracles in front of the people, they still did not believe in him.

38.verse: This was to bring about what Isaiah the prophet had said: “Lord, who believed what we told them? Who saw the Lord’s power in this?” Isaiah 53:1

39.verse: This is why the people could not believe: Isaiah also had said,

40.verse: “He has blinded their eyes, and he has closed their minds. Otherwise they would see with their eyes and understand in their minds and come back to me and be healed.” Isaiah 6:10

41.verse: Isaiah said this because he saw Jesus’ glory and spoke about him.

42.verse: But many believed in Jesus, even many of the leaders. But because of the Pharisees, they did not say they believed in him for fear they would be put out of the synagogue.

43.verse: They loved praise from people more than praise from God.

44.verse: Then Jesus cried out, “Whoever believes in me is really believing in the One who sent me.

45.verse: Whoever sees me sees the One who sent me.

46.verse: I have come as light into the world so that whoever believes in me would not stay in darkness.

47.verse: “Anyone who hears my words and does not obey them, I do not judge, because I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.

48.verse: There is a judge for those who refuse to believe in me and do not accept my words. The word I have taught will be their judge on the last day.

49.verse: The things I taught were not from myself. The Father who sent me told me what to say and what to teach.

50.verse: And I know that eternal life comes from what the Father commands. So whatever I say is what the Father told me to say.”

1.verse: Jesus Washes His Followers’ Feet - It was almost time for the Passover Feast. Jesus knew that it was time for him to leave this world and go back to the Father. He had always loved those who were his own in the world, and he loved them all the way to the end.

2.verse: Jesus and his followers were at the evening meal. The devil had already persuaded Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, to turn against Jesus.

3.verse: Jesus knew that the Father had given him power over everything and that he had come from God and was going back to God.

4.verse: So during the meal Jesus stood up and took off his outer clothing. Taking a towel, he wrapped it around his waist.

5.verse: Then he poured water into a bowl and began to wash the followers’ feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.

6.verse: Jesus came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”

7.verse: Jesus answered, “You don’t understand now what I am doing, but you will understand later.”

8.verse: Peter said, “No, you will never wash my feet.” Jesus answered, “If I don’t wash your feet, you are not one of my people.”

9.verse: Simon Peter answered, “Lord, then wash not only my feet, but wash my hands and my head, too!”

10.verse: Jesus said, “After a person has had a bath, his whole body is clean. He needs only to wash his feet. And you men are clean, but not all of you.”

11.verse: Jesus knew who would turn against him, and that is why he said, “Not all of you are clean.”

12.verse: When he had finished washing their feet, he put on his clothes and sat down again. He asked, “Do you understand what I have just done for you?

13.verse: You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and you are right, because that is what I am.

14.verse: If I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash each other’s feet.

15.verse: I did this as an example so that you should do as I have done for you.

16.verse: I tell you the truth, a servant is not greater than his master. A messenger is not greater than the one who sent him.

17.verse: If you know these things, you will be blessed if you do them.

18.verse: “I am not talking about all of you. I know those I have chosen. But this is to bring about what the Scripture said: ‘The man who ate at my table has turned against me.’

19.verse: I am telling you this now before it happens so that when it happens, you will believe that I am he.

20.verse: I tell you the truth, whoever accepts anyone I send also accepts me. And whoever accepts me also accepts the One who sent me.”

21.verse: Jesus Talks About His Death - After Jesus said this, he was very troubled. He said openly, “I tell you the truth, one of you will turn against me.”

22.verse: The followers all looked at each other, because they did not know whom Jesus was talking about.

23.verse: One of the followers sitting next to Jesus was the follower Jesus loved.

24.verse: Simon Peter motioned to him to ask Jesus whom he was talking about.

25.verse: That follower leaned closer to Jesus and asked, “Lord, who is it?”

26.verse: Jesus answered, “I will dip this bread into the dish. The man I give it to is the man who will turn against me.” So Jesus took a piece of bread, dipped it, and gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.

27.verse: As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered him. Jesus said to him, “The thing that you will do—do it quickly.”

28.verse: No one at the table understood why Jesus said this to Judas.

29.verse: Since he was the one who kept the money box, some of the followers thought Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the feast or to give something to the poor.

30.verse: Judas took the bread Jesus gave him and immediately went out. It was night.

31.verse: When Judas was gone, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man receives his glory, and God receives glory through him.

32.verse: If God receives glory through him, then God will give glory to the Son through himself. And God will give him glory quickly.”

33.verse: Jesus said, “My children, I will be with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and what I told the Jews, I tell you now: Where I am going you cannot come.

34.verse: “I give you a new command: Love each other. You must love each other as I have loved you.

35.verse: All people will know that you are my followers if you love each other.”

36.verse: Peter Will Say He Doesn’t Know Jesus - Simon Peter asked Jesus, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered, “Where I am going you cannot follow now, but you will follow later.”

37.verse: Peter asked, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I am ready to die for you!”

38.verse: Jesus answered, “Are you ready to die for me? I tell you the truth, before the rooster crows, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”

1.verse: Jesus Comforts His Followers - Jesus said, “Don’t let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God, and trust in me.

2.verse: There are many rooms in my Father’s house; I would not tell you this if it were not true. I am going there to prepare a place for you.

3.verse: After I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back and take you to be with me so that you may be where I am.

4.verse: You know the way to the place where I am going.”

5.verse: Thomas said to Jesus, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. So how can we know the way?”

6.verse: Jesus answered, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. The only way to the Father is through me.

7.verse: If you really knew me, you would know my Father, too. But now you do know him, and you have seen him.”

8.verse: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father. That is all we need.”

9.verse: Jesus answered, “I have been with you a long time now. Do you still not know me, Philip? Whoever has seen me has seen the Father. So why do you say, ‘Show us the Father’?

10.verse: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words I say to you don’t come from me, but the Father lives in me and does his own work.

11.verse: Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and the Father is in me. Or believe because of the miracles I have done.

12.verse: I tell you the truth, whoever believes in me will do the same things that I do. Those who believe will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father.

13.verse: And if you ask for anything in my name, I will do it for you so that the Father’s glory will be shown through the Son.

14.verse: If you ask me for anything in my name, I will do it.

15.verse: The Promise of the Holy Spirit - “If you love me, you will obey my commands.

16.verse: I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper to be with you forever—

17.verse: the Spirit of truth. The world cannot accept him, because it does not see him or know him. But you know him, because he lives with you and he will be in you.

18.verse: “I will not leave you all alone like orphans; I will come back to you.

19.verse: In a little while the world will not see me anymore, but you will see me. Because I live, you will live, too.

20.verse: On that day you will know that I am in my Father, and that you are in me and I am in you.

21.verse: Those who know my commands and obey them are the ones who love me, and my Father will love those who love me. I will love them and will show myself to them.”

22.verse: Then Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, “But, Lord, why do you plan to show yourself to us and not to the rest of the world?”

23.verse: Jesus answered, “If people love me, they will obey my teaching. My Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.

24.verse: Those who do not love me do not obey my teaching. This teaching that you hear is not really mine; it is from my Father, who sent me.

25.verse: “I have told you all these things while I am with you.

26.verse: But the Helper will teach you everything and will cause you to remember all that I told you. This Helper is the Holy Spirit whom the Father will send in my name.

27.verse: “I leave you peace; my peace I give you. I do not give it to you as the world does. So don’t let your hearts be troubled or afraid.

28.verse: You heard me say to you, ‘I am going, but I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you should be happy that I am going back to the Father, because he is greater than I am.

29.verse: I have told you this now, before it happens, so that when it happens, you will believe.

30.verse: I will not talk with you much longer, because the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me,

31.verse: but the world must know that I love the Father, so I do exactly what the Father told me to do. “Come now, let us go.

1.verse: Jesus Is Like a Vine - “I am the true vine; my Father is the gardener.

2.verse: He cuts off every branch of mine that does not produce fruit. And he trims and cleans every branch that produces fruit so that it will produce even more fruit.

3.verse: You are already clean because of the words I have spoken to you.

4.verse: Remain in me, and I will remain in you. A branch cannot produce fruit alone but must remain in the vine. In the same way, you cannot produce fruit alone but must remain in me.

5.verse: “I am the vine, and you are the branches. If any remain in me and I remain in them, they produce much fruit. But without me they can do nothing.
